catalog_info.title: The Psychology of Cooperation
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: The Psychology Department requires undergraduates to complete Science of Living Systems 20 (or equivalent) and at least one foundational course from PSY 14, PSY 15, PSY 18 or Science of Living Systems 15 before enrolling in this course.
catalog_info.description: Why and how do humans cooperate? What are the origins of these behaviors in human development and evolution? In this course we discuss how research in psychology, behavioral economics and primatology can provide insight into the foundation of human cooperation. This includes the study of empathy, altruism, fairness, and collaboration.
